title: Market Capitalization and Valuation Metrics of SuRo Capital Corp

content.text: As of the latest available data, the market capitalization of SuRo Capital Corp is XYZ million dollars. Market capitalization represents the total value of a company's outstanding shares, calculated by multiplying the current stock price by the number of outstanding shares.
To assess the valuation of SuRo Capital Corp, several relevant valuation metrics can be considered. These include:

The P/E ratio compares the market price per share of a company to its earnings per share (EPS). It indicates how much investors are willing to pay for each dollar of earnings. SuRo Capital Corp has a P/E ratio of XYZ, which can be compared to the industry average or similar companies to evaluate its relative valuation.

The P/S ratio divides the market price per share by the company's revenue per share. It provides insight into how much investors are willing to pay for each dollar of sales generated by the company. SuRo Capital Corp has a P/S ratio of XYZ, which can also be compared to industry benchmarks.

The P/B ratio compares the market price per share to the company's book value per share, representing the value of its assets minus liabilities. SuRo Capital Corp has a P/B ratio of XYZ, which can be analyzed relative to the industry average or similar firms.

The dividend yield measures the annual dividend income per share relative to the stock price. As SuRo Capital Corp is primarily a venture capital firm, it may not pay regular dividends, and its dividend yield might be insignificant.

Additional valuation metrics like enterprise value (EV) to EBITDA ratio or free cash flow yield can also provide insights into the company's valuation. However, specific data for SuRo Capital Corp in these metrics is not available in the provided information.

In conclusion, SuRo Capital Corp has a market capitalization of XYZ million dollars. Its valuation metrics, such as the P/E ratio, P/S ratio, and P/B ratio, can be compared to industry benchmarks to assess its relative valuation. Further analysis of additional valuation metrics would provide a more comprehensive evaluation.

news.headline: SuRo Capital Corp. Will Commence a Modified Dutch Auction Tender Offer to Repurchase up to 2 Million Shares of its Common Stock
news.summary: Reaffirms Anticipated 2023 Year-End NAV of $7.85 to $8.35 Per ShareNEW YORK, Feb. 14, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- SuRo Capital Corp. (“SuRo Capital”, the “Company”, “we”, “us”, and “our”) (Nasdaq: SSSS) announced today that it will commence a modified “Dutch Auction” tender offer (the “Tender Offer”) to purchase up to 2 million shares of its common stock at a price per share not less than $4.00 and not greater than $5.00 in $0.10 increments, using available cash. “As we have consistently demonstrat
